_comment: Do not manually edit this file, or update these source phrases in Crowdin. The source of truth for English strings are in the code source

inspect.subtitle: {{queryCount}} queries with total query time of {{formatted}}
inspect.title: Inspect: {{panelTitle}}

inspect-data.download-excel-description: Adds header to CSV for use with Excel
inspect-data.formatted-data-description: Table data is formatted with options defined in the Field and Override tabs.
inspect-data.transformations-description: Table data is displayed with transformations defined in the panel Transform tab.

inspect-json.dataframe-description: Raw data without transformations and field config applied.
inspect-json.panel-data-description: The raw model passed to the panel visualization
inspect-json.panel-json-description: The model saved in the dashboard JSON that configures how everything works.

add-modal.error: Library panel with this name already exists
add-modal.folder-description: Library panel permissions are derived from the folder permissions
add-modal.name: Library panel name

admin.subtitle: Manage server-wide settings and access to resources such as organizations, users, and licenses
admin.title: Server admin

alerting.subtitle: Learn about problems in your systems moments after they occur
alerting.title: Alerting

alerting-am-routes.subtitle: Determine how alerts are routed to contact points
alerting-am-routes.title: Notification policies

alerting-groups.subtitle: See grouped alerts from an Alertmanager instance
alerting-groups.title: Groups

alerting-list.subtitle: Rules that determine whether an alert will fire
alerting-list.title: Alert rules

alerting-receivers.subtitle: Decide how your contacts are notified when an alert fires
alerting-receivers.title: Contact points

alerting-silences.subtitle: Stop notifications from one or more alerting rules
alerting-silences.title: Silences

api-keys.subtitle: Manage and create API keys that are used to interact with Grafana HTTP APIs
api-keys.title: API keys

apps.subtitle: App plugins that extend the Grafana experience
apps.title: Apps

dashboards.subtitle: Create and manage dashboards to visualize your data
dashboards.title: Dashboards

global-orgs.subtitle: Isolated instances of Grafana running on the same server
global-orgs.title: Organizations

global-users.subtitle: Manage and create users across the whole Grafana server
global-users.title: Users (All orgs)

library-panels.subtitle: Reusable panels that can be added to multiple dashboards
library-panels.title: Library panels

playlists.subtitle: Groups of dashboards that are displayed in a sequence
playlists.title: Playlists

plugins.subtitle: Extend the Grafana experience with plugins
plugins.title: Plugins

server-settings.subtitle: View the settings defined in your Grafana config
server-settings.title: Settings

service-accounts.subtitle: Use service accounts to run automated workloads in Grafana
service-accounts.title: Service accounts

snapshots.subtitle: Interactive, publically available, point-in-time representations of dashboards
snapshots.title: Snapshots

starred-empty.title: Your starred dashboards will appear here

teams.subtitle: Groups of users that have common dashboard and permission needs
teams.title: Teams

users.subtitle: Invite and assign roles to users
users.title: Users

kiosk.tv-alert: Press ESC to exit kiosk mode

aria-label.choose-interval: Auto refresh turned off. Choose refresh time interval
aria-label.duration-selected: Choose refresh time interval with current interval {{durationAriaLabel}} selected

embed.html-description: The HTML code below can be pasted and included in another web page. Unless anonymous access is enabled, the user viewing that page need to be signed into Grafana for the graph to load.
embed.info: Generate HTML for embedding an iframe with this panel.
embed.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range

link.info-text: Create a direct link to this dashboard or panel, customized with the options below.
link.render-instructions: To render a panel image, you must install the <1>Grafana image renderer plugin</1>. Please contact your Grafana administrator to install the plugin.
link.save-dashboard: To render a panel image, you must save the dashboard first.
link.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range

snapshot.deleted-message: The snapshot has been deleted. If you have already accessed it once, then it might take up to an hour before before it is removed from browser caches or CDN caches.
snapshot.info-text-1: A snapshot is an instant way to share an interactive dashboard publicly. When created, we strip sensitive data like queries (metric, template, and annotation) and panel links, leaving only the visible metric data and series names embedded in your dashboard.
snapshot.info-text-2: Keep in mind, your snapshot <1>can be viewed by anyone</1> that has the link and can access the URL. Share wisely.
snapshot.name: Snapshot name
snapshot.timeout-description: You might need to configure the timeout value if it takes a long time to collect your dashboard metrics.

content.empty-recent-list: <0><0>It looks like you haven't used this time picker before. As soon as you enter some time intervals, recently used intervals will appear here.</0></0><1><0>Read the documentation</0><1> to find out more about how to enter custom time ranges.</1></1>

range-content.default-error: Please enter a past date or "now"
